description.narrative:
A $20 million USD vehicle for UNICEF, modeled on the support and analysis approaches of successful venture investment structures, that will quickly assess, fund, and scale innovations, both internal to UNICEF and external, that work
The innovation facility will offer the following services: ¿ quick assessments of innovative ideas and projects in the UNICEF country offices based on a number of set criteria on the ideas¿ and projects¿ potential to be taken to scale. ¿ funding of innovative ideas and projects to allow them to reach a point where they are presenting the data to scale ¿ globally rigorous yet regionally sensitive evaluation and monitoring of projects. ¿ a portfolio-based approach to UNICEF¿s challenges ¿ technical assistance from the globally recognized UNICEF Innovation Team
The UNICEF Innovation Facility first round will be capped at $20 million, and guided by a small advisory board from UNICEF headquarters, regional and country offices.
Based on analysis of previous projects, UNICEF¿s innovation work takes 2 years to mature. The facility would be revisited after 12 months to assess operations and add additional funders.
